name: Qiddiya Investment Company
title: Senior Specialist - Strategy COR407
description: senior specialist - strategy cor407 qiddiya investment company, a visionary leader in the development of entertainment and leisure destinations, is looking for an analytical and strategic thinker to join our team as a senior specialist - strategy. in this role, you will be responsible for supporting the development and execution of strategic initiatives that drive our organizational goals and position qiddiya for future success. responsibilities develop relevant strategies for qiddiya's destination management & marketing organization (dmmo) focusing on the tourism industry design and detail operating models, develop governance and organizational structures, as well as policies, procedures, and processes research, benchmark, and analyze frameworks and methodologies needed to address specific project needs with clear strategic recommendations and solutions conduct research and analyses about entertainment, sports, and culture sectors and develop relevant strategic, business, and financial plans research and expand on knowledge of ksa's travel trade environment and others as needed assist with developing dmmo's budget assist with developing and maintaining dmmo's business and marketing plan assist with developing dmmo's performance framework (objectives, kpis, initiatives, etc.) and track/report corporate performance develop relevant project plans (ms project) across dmmo's units and track/report progress prepare content for periodic board/executive meetings and participate in specific committees as required execute projects with multiple stakeholders and coordinate discussions with internal and external stakeholders coordinate relationships with relevant tourism government entities and develop agenda, minutes of meeting, and other relevant tasks provide ongoing support to dmmo's management team and participate in ad hoc requests develop content for presentations and synthesis reports (expert in powerpoint presentations, excel, word, etc.) requirements bachelor's degree in business, economics, marketing, or a related field (master's degree preferred) a minimum of 2-4 years of experience in strategy development, transformation or management consulting strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret data and derive actionable insights excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple priorities proficient in strategic planning tools and methodologies knowledge of the entertainment or tourism industry is a plus job id 686c4c1852
label: Other
LLM_soft_skills: communication, teamwork, analytical thinking, problem-solving, coordination, strategic thinking, presentation, adaptability, ability to interpret data
LLM_technical_skills: strategic planning, business planning, financial planning, performance framework development, research and analysis, governance, organizational structure development, budget development

name: Islamic Development Bank
title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist
description: job purpose the talent acquisition specialist is focusing on the attraction and acquisition of managerial and leadership roles in isdb, this includes the attraction and acquisition of director general, director, manager and associate manager roles as per the approved recruitment plans, in line with the established procedures, in order to satisfy isdb's managerial and leadership needs. the talent acquisition senior specialist is mandated to (i) execute the entire cycle of the recruitment process (requisition-to-joining) by proactively searching and sourcing most suitable candidates, managing headhunting and executive search activities, arranging leadership assessments and selection interviews and issuing job offers, and carrying out the entire (ii) pre-joining on-boarding and post-joining on-boarding activities, with an aim to hire the best fit managerial and leadership talents to meet the business requirements of isdb. (iii) in addition to that, the talent acquisition senior specialist is mandated to prepare talent market research insights, outreach and benchmarking activities and periodic recruitment analytics and metrics. key accountabilities talent acquisition operations: effectively participate in the development of the talent acquisition strategy and associated programs (including the evaluation and selection of headhunting and executive search firms (contingency vs. retained), leadership assessments methodologies and services providers, candidates sourcing channels, employer branding activities and communication) in line with lsdb's and the hr's short, medium, and long- term objectives to attract, motivate and retain the best talent. responsible for regular review and assessment of the services provided by the third- party contracts (headhunting and executive search firms, leadership assessments etc.), benchmark with similar services available in the job market, and submit evaluation reports and recommendations. prepare talent market research insights and perform outreach and benchmarking activities. responsible for the execution of recruitment analytics and metrics. conduct digitization, quality assurance and information reliability and governance projects. enhance the utilization of the recruitment channels (website, search and recruitment firms, social networks, etc.). execute all recruitment activities related to the attraction and acquisition of managerial and leadership roles in isdb (director general, director, manager and associate manager) as per the approved recruitment plans, to ensure attraction of the best fit talents that can enable isdb achieve its strategic objectives. perform the selection and deployment of modern personnel selection and recruitment tools (e.g. psychometric tests, behavioral fitness, business cases, technical and competencies-based interviews etc.). manage the pre-selection processes like screening of cv's and arranging interview calls with coordination with business units. consolidate leadership assessment reports and technical interview results from the different interview rounds and present the final selection outcomes. prepare offers, discuss and negotiate with the selected candidates, follow up with the candidates for necessary confirmation of the offer made as well as to agree on the joining date. carrying out the 4 types of the on-boarding processes of the new joiners (international joiners to hq, international joiners to regional hubs, national joiners to hq and internal joiners) and ensure smooth execution of the different pre-joining on-boarding and post-joining on-boarding activities including onboarding guidelines and general requirements, reference checks, government relations requirements, work visa issuance and endorsement process, medical checkups and employment fitness, travel and logistics, and provide needed guidance for the candidates in every onboarding step. manage the internal communications and relationships between internal business units involved in the new hires' joining process (government relations, medical unit, admin services, imdt and travel unit) for all pre and post joining requirements. identify and recommend external service providers, like recruitment firms, assessment consultants and background checkers etc. work with the imdt to identify and recommend talent acquisition software / portals to improve efficiency and transparency in the sourcing and recruitment process. policies and procedures: conduct policies and procedures reviews as per management instructions under the supervision of the lead talent acquisition. continuously conduct improvement by identifying more efficient/creative ways and means to achieve the sourcing strategies and objectives in line with the best practices. develop and review recruitment slas. develop headhunting and leadership assessment guidelines and procedures. knowledge sharing: transferring tacit (undocumented) and explicit (documented) knowledge and information to talent acquisition specialists/officers by providing continues coaching and on-job training for talent acquisition specialists/officers, leading by example and participating in building learning culture. keep abreast with the best practices in the areas of talent acquisition and recommend improvements / adoption in isdb. educate relevant staff in the business units and within hrmd on the matters pertaining to talent acquisition, trends and isdb policies. reporting and communication: provide recruitment internal insights (recruitment analytics, metrics and indices) and external insights (market research and benchmarking reports) provide timely and accurate reports pertaining to talent acquisition status and recruitment slas (regularly/ad-hoc) to provide the lead talent acquisition and the concerned business units of the latest updates regarding the active recruitment portfolio. manage internal and external communications (including isdb group various entities) to ensure effective coordination and cooperation related to the talent acquisition area. prepare periodical reports highlighting the latest status of recruitment progress and future plans and share with the relevant hrbp. academic and professional qualifications bachelor's degree in human resources, organizational behavior, business administration or any related field. certifications from hrci / shrm / cipd are advantageous. master's degree in human resources, organizational behavior, business administration or any related field a plus. minimum 8 years of relevant experience in talent acquisition, sourcing and recruiting preferably in a multilateral development bank, ifi or global organization. skills & necessary knowledge excellent knowledge of the local, regional and global recruitment trends. knowledge of job analysis, job designing and job descriptions development. high level of confidentiality and attention to detail advanced presentation skills. advanced interviewing skills. advanced data-analysis. advanced ms office skills. hands-on experience in hr module and recruitment software. business acumen analytical thinking and problem solving advanced planning and organizing skills
label: Other
LLM_soft_skills: communication, teamwork, problem-solving, leadership, adaptability, attention to detail, confidentiality, coaching, analytical thinking, planning, organizing
LLM_technical_skills: talent acquisition, recruitment analytics, job analysis, job designing, interviewing skills, data analysis, behavioral assessment, psychometric tests, employer branding, outreach strategies

name: Islamic Development Bank
title: Operations Monitoring Specialist
description: job purpose coordinate in managing and maintaining the high quality of project portfolio data through developing effective processes of data entry by business users. ensure systematic and periodic data cleansing, monitoring data accuracy and data integrity, and proactively working towards enhancing quality at entry of data in the oms. monitor, analyze, and report on the performance of the isdb's operations portfolio data whilst ensuring portfolio data quality and integrity. through the application of quality standards and guidelines. key accountabilities operations data portfolio quality enhancement, monitoring, and reporting: ensure quality of operations data in the oms system based on the agreed standards, business processes and data governance framework. regularly monitor and report on the entry of operations data in the oms system in close coordination with the concerned business units. resolve all operations data related issues in the oms system in timely manner and report any challenges and problems to the oqm division manager. design and develop monitoring reports, based on the needs of the wider stakeholders, by coordinating with the information management and disruptive technologies (imdt) department on the design and deployment of the data warehouse and related it infrastructure for effective project management. contribute to the development and use of bi dashboards to monitor the transparency of the operations data across the project databases. provide advice in the development and deployment of tools and mechanisms to monitor the key performance indicators (kpis) for effective operations data management and project management and improve the functionalities of portfolio management applications. support the development and update of technical activities related to the enhancements of the core oms system, power bi, and other performance management tools by acting as a kbu for technical aspects, training, mentoring, and guiding the key business users across the bank. contribute to the identification and implementation of automation processes for effective data management and quality. portfolio monitoring: analyze, and report on the quality of operations portfolio data and performance of the isdb's operations portfolio by interpreting and evaluating complex historical data from risk exposure, project performance, and other critical success factors that could be incorporated in the effective formulation of future operations strategy of the bank. monitor and flag portfolio cleaning exercises by identifying projects facing delays and problems for remedial action. provide active support to the operations complex management in the decision-making process by providing operations data in-depth portfolio-related analysis and reports as needed monitor and produce periodic analytical reports of the operations portfolio to improve the implementation performance and highlight trends for remedial actions and recommendations. adopt best practices in operations data and portfolio management based on the experience of international development financing institutions, mdbs, and relevant best practices. portfolio support and enhancement: ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of the data captured in the project management systems, by conducting regular project data quality audits collaborate with imdt department to establish and operationalize a support mechanism for the users of the project management system within and outside the operations complex. support knowledge-sharing workshops, seminars, etc. for the benefit of key business users on the portfolio performance monitoring methods systems and tools, regarding the effective application of the systems in an efficient manner for optimum business delivery. disseminate knowledge related to operations portfolio throughout the bank through regular reports, analysis, newsletters, talks, etc. guide and train key business users, otls, and other staff in the regional hubs for enhancing their knowledge and understanding of the core operations management system (oms) as a subject matter expert (sme) and resolve any technical aspects related to the system. academic and professional qualifications bachelor's degree in computing, economics, engineering, business administration, sciences or related discipline. minimum 5 years of relevant experience, with a focus on operations portfolio management, business information management and database management. skills & necessary knowledge advanced database management skills. advanced business intelligence skills. advanced project management skills, covering the entire project life cycle. proficient understanding of operational policies, guidelines, procedures, policy compliance and quality assurance. ability to work with different stakeholders. ability to articulate and influence others. advanced report-writing skills. proficient planning & organizing skills. proficient presentation skills.

name: NTT DATA
title: IT Governance Specialist
description: make an impact with ntt data join a company that is pushing the boundaries of what is possible. we are renowned for our technical excellence and leading innovations, and for making a difference to our clients and society. our workplace embraces diversity and inclusion â€“ itâ€™s a place where you can grow, belong and thrive. your day at ntt data the information security governance, risk and compliance (grc) specialist is a seasoned subject matter expert, responsible for supporting the organization's information security program by assessing risks, implementing security controls, ensuring compliance, managing security awareness initiatives, and contributing to policy development. this role collaborates with internal teams to enhance security practices and maintain a strong security posture. what you'll be doing key responsibilities: objective definition: the it governance specialist determines the objectives for it. these objectives define the purpose of it and describe how it will be fulfilled. they should be included in any it vision or mission statements and implemented using a strategic it plan. governance framework design: the specialist designs and implements the it governance framework. this framework includes governance principles, policies, it governance roles and responsibilities, and processes. it must align with the organizationâ€™s wider governance responsibilities and support the achievement of the companyâ€™s goals and strategic objectives. risk management: managing risks related to it systems is a critical aspect. the specialist identifies potential risks, assesses their impact, and develops strategies to mitigate them. this includes ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards. policy development: developing and implementing it policies is essential. these policies guide it practices, security measures, and compliance requirements. the specialist ensures that policies are well-communicated and followed across the organization. data governance: in some cases, an it governance specialist may also be involved in data governance. this includes defining data quality standards, ensuring data integrity, and coordinating with data stewards and other stakeholders. efficiency and security optimization: maximizing the efficiency and security of a companyâ€™s it infrastructure is a core responsibility. the specialist collaborates with various teams to achieve this goal. qualifications: education: a bachelorâ€™s degree in a relevant field such as information technology, computer science, or business administration is often required. preferred certifications: certified in risk and information systems control (crisc). certified information security manager (cism). itil (information technology infrastructure library). experience: typically, 3-5 years of relevant work experience in it governance, risk management, or related fields. experience with it policies, compliance, and audit processes is valuable. skills: risk assessment and management: ability to identify and mitigate risks related to it systems. policy development and implementation: crafting and enforcing it policies. communication: strong verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with various teams. analytical thinking: assessing complex situations and making informed decisions. attention to detail: ensuring compliance and accuracy. leadership: guiding teams and stakeholders. problem-solving: addressing governance challenges effectively. workplace type: on-site working about ntt data ntt data is a $30+ billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. we serve 75% of the fortune global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. we invest over $3.6 billion each year in r&d to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. as a global top employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure, and connectivity. we are also one of the leading providers of digital and ai infrastructure in the world. ntt data is part of ntt group and headquartered in tokyo. equal opportunity employer ntt data is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. we do not discriminate based on age, race, colour, gender, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, disability, pregnancy, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected category. join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. apply today.

name: ALSTOM
title: Material Planner - AlUla Tramway Project
description: at alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. from high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars. could you be the full-time onsite material planner in alula, sa weâ€™re looking for? your future role take on a new challenge and apply your detail-oriented and strategic planning expertise in a new cutting-edge field. youâ€™ll work alongside dedicated, collaborative, and forward-thinking teammates. you'll manage your supplier's portfolio to ensure the timely, accurate, and efficient delivery of goods, directly impacting alstom's operational success. day-to-day, youâ€™ll work closely with teams across the business (such as procurement, logistics, and quality management), express delivery needs to suppliers and contribute to the governance of the supplier's delivery performances, and much more. weâ€™ll look to you for: monitoring and managing internal and/or external suppliers to meet alstom's delivery schedules, ensuring the accuracy of goods delivered in terms of quantity, specifications, and quality, communicating effectively with suppliers to convey delivery needs and expectations, participating in the evaluation and governance of supplier's delivery performances, implementing action plans aimed at performance improvement and proactive risk management, collaborating closely with the procurement team to align contractual agreements with erp system entries, analyzing supply chain data to anticipate potential disruptions or delays, engaging in continuous improvement initiatives within the supply chain process, maintaining a strong understanding of the supply market and trends to inform planning strategies, contributing to cross-departmental projects and teams to enhance overall supply chain efficiency all about you we value passion and attitude over experience. thatâ€™s why we donâ€™t expect you to have every single skill. instead, weâ€™ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role: degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field., experience or understanding of materials planning and supply chain processes in a manufacturing or production environment., knowledge of enterprise resource planning (erp) systems and their application in supply chain management., familiarity with supplier relationship management and performance evaluation techniques., excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively express delivery needs and collaborate with suppliers and internal teams., proven problem-solving skills to contribute to risk management strategies., adaptability to work in a dynamic environment where continuous improvement is embraced. things youâ€™ll enjoy join us on a life-long transformative journey â€“ the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. youâ€™ll also: collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues, work with cutting-edge supply chain strategies and tools to ensure efficient material planning and supplier management, progress towards becoming a key player in the optimization of our supply chain processes and a specialist in risk management and supplier performance improvement, contribute to innovative projects you donâ€™t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. we guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, youâ€™ll be proud. if youâ€™re up for the challenge, weâ€™d love to hear from you! important to note as a global business, weâ€™re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. weâ€™re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone. job segment: erp, logistics, risk management, supply chain, supply chain manager, technology, operations, finance

title: Draftsman
description: date posted: 2025-02-03 country: saudi arabia location: otis elevator company saudi arabia ltd, 1st floor, tower a, al malga business center, anas bin malik street, al malga, riyadh, saudi arabia key responsibilities drafts installation drawings on the basis of customer supplied drawings, standard drawings and field inputs given by the fod/sales team. designs diagrams, maps and layouts with computer-aided design (cad) software to illustrate project workflow. issues layouts to sales team according to site data. verifies installation drawings with fod teams for technical details and sales team for verification of specification at project completion. identifies potential operational issues and redesigns products to improve functionality. ensures final designs comply with regulations and quality standards. maintains custody of soft copy backups and hard copies of all drawings, inclusive of all revised, commented drawing versions. creates manuals that describe existing productsâ€™ operation, features and maintenance. ensures approved layouts are save in the system with client contract number. provides summary report on progress of drawings for the concerned fod team and reports exceptions. defines performance goals at the start of the year in discussion with the reporting manager and ensures that the goals are achieved during the course of the year. identifies the training and development requirements for self and agrees on them with the reporting manager to ensure that the required trainings are arranged and attended. strives to achieve the fluent written and spoken english essential, arabic preferred saudi nationals preferred if you live in a city, chances are we will give you a lift or play a role in keeping you moving every day. otis the industry's largest service portfolio. you may recognize our products in some of the worldâ€™s most famous landmarks including the eiffel tower, empire state building, burj khalifa and the petronas twin towers! we are 69,000 people strong, including engineers, digital technology experts, sales, and functional specialists, as well as factory and field technicians, all committed to meeting the diverse needs of our customers and passengers in more than 200 countries and territories worldwide. we are proud to be a diverse, global team with a proven legacy of innovation that continues to be the bedrock of a fast-moving, high-performance company. when you join otis, you become part of an innovative global industry leader with a resilient business model. youâ€™ll belong to a diverse, trusted, and caring community where your contributions, and the skills and capabilities youâ€™ll gain working alongside the best and brightest, keep us connected and on the cutting edge. we provide opportunities, training, and resources, that build leadership and capabilities in sales, field, engineering and major projects and our employee scholar program is a notable point of pride, through
